prompt:
Information: Document ID: 1
Title: Optic nerve
Content: The optic nerve leaves the orbit (eye socket) via the optic canal, running postero-medially towards the optic chiasm, where there is a partial decussation (crossing) of fibers from the temporal visual fields (the nasal hemi-retina) of both eyes. The proportion of decussating fibers varies between species, and is correlated with the degree of binocular vision enjoyed by a species. Most of the axons of the optic nerve terminate in the lateral geniculate nucleus from where information is relayed to the visual cortex, while other axons terminate in the pretectal nucleus and are involved in reflexive eye movements. Other axons terminate in the suprachiasmatic nucleus and are involved in regulating the sleep-wake cycle. Its diameter increases from about 1.6 mm within the eye to 3.5 mm in the orbit to 4.5 mm within the cranial space. The optic nerve component lengths are 1 mm in the globe, 24 mm in the orbit, 9 mm in the optic canal, and 16 mm in the cranial space before joining the optic chiasm. There, partial decussation occurs, and about 53% of the fibers cross to form the optic tracts. Most of these fibers terminate in the lateral geniculate body.
---
Document ID: 2
Title: Nervio óptico
Content: El nervio óptico es el segundo de los doce nervios craneales emparejados y es técnicamente parte del sistema nervioso central, en lugar del sistema nervioso periférico porque se deriva de una bolsa de la sola de las tallas de diezphalon (tallos ópticos) durante el desarrollo embrionario. Como consecuencia, las fibras del nervio óptico están cubiertas con mielina producidas por oligodendrocitos, en lugar de células Schwann del sistema nervioso periférico, y están encerrados dentro de las meninges. Las neuropatías periféricas como el síndrome de Guillain -Barré no afectan el nervio óptico. Sin embargo, la mayoría del nervio óptico se agrupa con los otros once nervios craneales y se considera parte del sistema nervioso periférico.
---

Esto causó un gran resentimiento entre el clero secular de la diócesis, quien sintió que los estaban siendo rechazados. Al final, las negociaciones con los benedictinos ingleses y la comunidad de benedictinos franceses en Farnborough fracasaron y se estableció un coro 'tradicional' de hombres y niños. A pesar de los grandes problemas financieros, la escuela del coro abrió el 5 de octubre de 1901 con once coristas de niños, en el edificio originalmente destinado a los monjes benedictinos. El cardenal Vaughan recibió a los niños con las palabras "Usted es la base". El coro de la catedral fue instituido oficialmente tres meses después en enero de 1902. Las masas y oficinas cantadas se establecieron inmediatamente cuando la catedral abrió para adorar en 1903, y continuaron sin interrupción desde entonces. Hoy, el coro de la Catedral de Westminster es el único coro católico profesional en el mundo en cantar misa y vísperas diarias.

prompt:

Title: History of Dutch nationality
Content: Even though urban governments showed rare signs of democracy they were primarily an oligarchic system marked by an exclusive hierarchy. Class divisions, however were not as deep as in other European states, and the rights that the common class possessed did not differ much from what the intellectuals could practice. There was a cultural harmony and it prevented the formation of two completely divided classes and allowed for a social participation of all. Similarly, the basis of education was the same for all, and this allowed for a social bond. The difference in rights that the upper and lower classes possessed was reduced to the amount of money available to the individual. If one was wealthy, he could afford higher-level education. However, this alone did not earn him any political privileges or extensive political rights but only the ability to earn more wealth. 
The whole population of the Dutch Republic did not have the choice of voting for the representative of the Country inasmuch as there was not a choice between a democracy and an aristocracy but rather between an aristocracy and a monarchy. The stadtholder would be a member of the House of Orange-Nassau.

claim: Robert Hooke is credited as the first person to identify and describe cells, a discovery he made in the 17th century after improvements in microscope technology allowed him to observe the microscopic structure of cork and coin the term “cell” for the box-like structures he saw
question_en: Who first identified the cell?
report_en: Robert Hooke is credited as the first person to identify and describe cells, a discovery he made in the 17th century after improvements in microscope technology allowed him to observe the microscopic structure of cork and coin the term “cell” for the box-like structures he saw [1].

prompt:
Information: Document ID: 1
Title: Cell theory
Content: In biology, cell theory is the historic scientific theory, now universally accepted, that living organisms are made up of cells, that they are the basic structural/organizational unit of all organisms, and that all cells come from pre-existing cells. Cells are the basic unit of structure in all organisms and also the basic unit of reproduction. With continual improvements made to microscopes over time, magnification technology advanced enough to discover cells in the 17th century. This discovery is largely attributed to Robert Hooke, and began the scientific study of cells, also known as cell biology. Over a century later, many debates about cells began amongst scientists. Most of these debates involved the nature of cellular regeneration, and the idea of cells as a fundamental unit of life. Cell theory was eventually formulated in 1839. This is usually credited to Matthias Schleiden and Theodor Schwann. However, many other scientists like Rudolf Virchow contributed to the theory. It was an important step in the movement away from spontaneous generation.
---
Document ID: 2
Title: Universidad de Toronto
Content: El descubrimiento de la insulina en la Universidad de Toronto en 1921 se considera entre los eventos más importantes en la historia de la medicina. La célula madre se descubrió en la Universidad en 1963, formando la base para el trasplante de médula ósea y todas las investigaciones posteriores sobre células madre adultas y embrionarias. Este fue el primero de muchos hallazgos en Toronto relacionados con las células madre, incluida la identificación de células madre pancreáticas y retinianas. La célula madre del cáncer fue identificada por primera vez en 1997 por investigadores de Toronto, que desde entonces han encontrado asociaciones de células madre en leucemia, tumores cerebrales y cáncer colorrectal. Las invenciones médicas desarrolladas en Toronto incluyen el índice glucémico, el pablum de cereales infantiles, el uso de hipotermia protectora en cirugía de corazón abierto y el primer marcapasos cardíaco artificial. El primer trasplante de pulmón único exitoso se realizó en Toronto en 1981, seguido por el primer trasplante nervioso en 1988, y el primer trasplante de doble pulmón en 1989. Los investigadores identificaron el factor de promoción de maduración que regula la división celular y descubrió el receptor de células T, que desencadena las respuestas del sistema inmune. Se le atribuye a la universidad a aislar los genes que causan anemia fanconi, fibrosis quística y enfermedad de Alzheimer de inicio temprano, entre muchas otras enfermedades. Entre 1914 y 1972, la Universidad operó los Laboratorios de Investigación Médica Connaught, ahora parte de la Corporación Pharmacéutica Sanofi-Aventis. Entre la investigación realizada en el laboratorio se encontraba el desarrollo de la electroforesis en gel.
---

claim: Digestive enzymes occur in multiple locations within the human body: they are distributed along the digestive tract to break down food after it is eaten, are present in the saliva produced by salivary glands to start digestion in the mouth, and reside inside cells—especially within lysosomes—where they degrade macromolecules to support cellular survival
question_en: Where are digestive enzymes found in the body?
report_en: Digestive enzymes occur in multiple locations within the human body: they are distributed along the digestive tract to break down food after it is eaten, are present in the saliva produced by salivary glands to start digestion in the mouth, and reside inside cells—especially within lysosomes—where they degrade macromolecules to support cellular survival [1].

claims_retained: Digestive enzymes occur in multiple locations within the human body: they are distributed along the digestive tract to break down food after it is eaten, are present in the saliva produced by salivary glands to start digestion in the mouth, and reside inside cells—especially within lysosomes—where they degrade macromolecules to support cellular survival [1].
prompt:

Title: Digestive enzyme
Content: Digestive enzymes are a group of enzymes that break down polymeric macromolecules into their smaller building blocks, in order to facilitate their absorption by the body. Digestive enzymes are found in the digestive tracts of animals (including humans) and in the traps of carnivorous plants, where they aid in the digestion of food, as well as inside cells, especially in their lysosomes, where they function to maintain cellular survival. Digestive enzymes of diverse specificities are found in the saliva secreted by the salivary glands, in the secretions of cells lining
---
Document ID: 2
Title: Plano
Content: El planario tiene sistemas de órganos muy simples. El sistema digestivo consiste en una boca, faringe y una cavidad gastrovascular. La boca está ubicada en el centro de la parte inferior del cuerpo. Las enzimas digestivas se secretan de la boca para comenzar la digestión externa. La faringe conecta la boca a la cavidad gastrovascular. Esta estructura se ramifica en todo el cuerpo que permite que los nutrientes de los alimentos alcancen todas las extremidades. Planaria come animales pequeños vivos o muertos que absorben con sus bocas musculosas. La comida pasa de la boca a través de la faringe hacia los intestinos donde se digiere que las células que recubren los intestinos. Entonces sus nutrientes se difunden al resto de la planaria.
---

prompt:
Information: Document ID: 1
Title: Climate of Uranus
Content: Several solutions have been proposed to explain the calm weather on Uranus. One proposed explanation for this dearth of cloud features is that Uranus's internal heat appears markedly lower than that of the other giant planets; in astronomical terms, it has a low internal thermal flux. Why Uranus's heat flux is so low is still not understood. Neptune, which is Uranus's near twin in size and composition, radiates 2.61 times as much energy into space as it receives from the Sun. Uranus, by contrast, radiates hardly any excess heat at all. The total power radiated by Uranus in the far infrared (i.e. heat) part of the spectrum is times the solar energy absorbed in its atmosphere. In fact, Uranus's heat flux is only  W/m², which is lower than the internal heat flux of Earth of about 0.075 W/m². The lowest temperature recorded in Uranus's tropopause is 49 K (−224 °C), making Uranus the coldest planet in the Solar System, colder than Neptune.
---
Document ID: 2
Title: Urano
Content: El calor interno de Urano parece notablemente más bajo que el de los otros planetas gigantes; En términos astronómicos, tiene un flujo térmico bajo. Por qué la temperatura interna de Urano es tan baja todavía no se entiende. Neptuno, que es el gemelo cercano de Urano en tamaño y composición, irradia 2.61 veces más energía en el espacio que recibe del sol, pero Urano irradia casi ningún exceso de calor. La potencia total irradiada por Urano en la parte infrarroja lejana (es decir, calor) del espectro es el tiempo de la energía solar absorbida en su atmósfera. El flujo de calor de Urano es solo, que es más bajo que el flujo de calor interno de la tierra de aproximadamente. La temperatura más baja registrada en la tropopausia de Urano es, lo que hace que Urano sea el planeta más frío del sistema solar.

report_en: Hawaii’s principal surface fault line is the Koa‘e Fault Zone on Kīlauea Volcano, a 12-kilometre-long series of east-northeast–trending fault scarps that links Kīlauea’s East Rift Zone near Pauahi Crater to its Southwest Rift Zone close to Mauna Iki on the Island of Hawai‘i; the zone is about 2 kilometres wide in the north-south direction and has been active for tens of thousands of years [1].

prompt:
Information: Document ID: 1
Title: Koa'e Fault Zone
Content: The Koa’e Fault Zone (pronounced coe-wah-hee) is a series of fault scarps connecting the East and Southwest Rift Zones on Kilauea Volcano on the Big Island of Hawaii. The fault zone intersects the East Rift near the Pauahi Crater and extends nearly 12 kilometers in an east-northeast direction towards the westernmost boundary near Mauna Iki and the Southwest Rift Zone. Boundaries of the Koa’e Fault Zone also cover 2 kilometers in a north-south orientation along the 12 kilometer length. It is believed that the fault zone has been active for tens of thousands of years. The area is infrequently visited by park patrons due to the lack of eruptive activity and closure of certain areas to the general public.
---
Document ID: 2
Title: Falla de tetón
Content: La falla de Teton se encuentra en una configuración geológica única. La falla está en el límite de cuatro provincias geológicas principales: la cuenca y la gama, el cinturón de empuje de Idaho-Wyoming, el antepasado de la montaña rocosa y la meseta volcánica de Yellowstone. La provincia de la cuenca y el rango es una región de la extensión de la corteza este-oeste. Esta provincia agrega tensión perpendicular a la línea de falla que hace que los bloques de falla se separen. El cinturón de empuje de Idaho-Wyoming se encuentra al sur de la falla del tetón y es una región de corteza gruesa y deformada que evita que la falla se extienda más al sur. Rocky Mountain Foreland se encuentra al este de la falla de Teton y es una región de corteza más gruesa. Esta sección de la corteza es más pesada y se suma a la fuerza vertical hacia abajo en la pared colgante de falla. La meseta volcánica de Yellowstone es una región de elevación y expansión que influye en las fuerzas verticales y horizontales en la falla del tetón.
---

prompt:

Title: Eugene Sternberg
Content: Eugene Sternberg (January 15, 1915 – June 5, 2005) was an Austro-Hungarian born American architect known for his passionate commitment and contribution to contemporary/modernist architecture and town planning in Colorado and other Rocky Mountain states between 1950 and 1990. He designed over 400 building projects and subdivisions, many of them iconic examples of Modernist architecture. Since his focus was on improving the quality of life of the general population, the structures he built were beautiful, useful, and cost-effective. Most of his projects were in the category of social architecture: affordable homes, senior housing projects, public housing, hospitals, medical clinics, public schools, community colleges, community centers, churches, buildings for credit unions, labor unions, and headquarters offices for Rural Electric Associations. As a planner Sternberg designed a number of innovative housing subdivisions and master plans for college campuses, governmental complexes, county fairgrounds, and a number of small western cities.
---
Document ID: 2
Title: Eugene Sternberg
Content: Sternberg nació durante la Primera Guerra Mundial en Pressburg, Austria-Hungría, donde su familia se había movido para estar con su padre mientras servía en el ejército austrohúngaro. Cuando la guerra, y el imperio austrohúngaro, terminaron en 1918, la familia regresó a su hogar en Munkács (ahora Mukachevo, Ucrania) en la provincia de Rutenia; En 1920 se convirtió en parte del país recién creado de Checoslovaquia.
Durante su educación primaria y secundaria. La principal pasión de Sternberg era el arte. Se convirtió en un joven artista consumado y ganó un lugar codiciado para estudiar arquitectura en la Universidad Técnica Checa en Praga. En los veranos trabajó para dos firmas de arquitectura en Munkács y para un conocido arquitecto checo, Frantisek Libra, en Praga. En 1938, obtuvo un primer título en arquitectura/ingeniería. La Alemania de Adolf Hitler ocupó Checoslovaquia en marzo de 1939. Debido a que a Sternberg se le ofreció una beca para la Escuela de Arquitectura Bartlett de la Universidad de Londres, tuvo la suerte de abandonar Checoslovaquia en 1939, la única de su gran familia judía para poder hacerlo.
---

question_en: Where is Fiji located in the world?
report_en: Fiji is an island nation in the South-West Pacific Ocean, located roughly midway between its nearest neighbours Vanuatu to the west and Tonga to the east [1]. The archipelago spreads across longitudes 176° 53′ E to 178° 12′ W, with the 180° meridian slicing through the island of Taveuni; however, the International Date Line bends around the group so the entire country observes the same time zone (UTC+12) [1]. claim: Zombies was first released for Microsoft Windows and OS X on 5 May 2009, launching simultaneously on Steam that same day
question_en: When was the game Plants vs. Zombies released?
report_en: Plants vs. Zombies was first released for Microsoft Windows and OS X on 5 May 2009, launching simultaneously on Steam that same day [1]. Subsequent ports followed: iOS in February 2010, an Xbox Live Arcade version with extra modes on 8 September 2010, Nintendo DS on 18 January 2011, PlayStation 3 in February 2011, Android via Amazon Appstore on 31 May 2011 and on Google Play on 14 December 2011, BlackBerry PlayBook on 16 February 2012, and BlackBerry 10 smartphones in January 2013; the original PC/Mac edition was also re-released as a “Game of the Year” version, and a free ad-supported iOS edition appeared in January 2015 [1].

An Android version of the game was released on May 31, 2011 on the Amazon Appstore, while it was also released to the Android Market (now Google Play) on December 14, 2011. On February 16, 2012, a version was released for BlackBerry PlayBook. Later, a BlackBerry smartphone version of the game was released on January 2013 following the launch of BlackBerry 10. Furthermore, both the original Windows and Mac version of the game have been re-released with additional content in a "Game of the Year" version. In January 2015, a free ad-supported version of the game was released for iOS.

prompt:
Information: Document ID: 1
Title: Edict of Expulsion
Content: The first Jewish communities of significant size came to England with William the Conqueror in 1066. After the conquest of England, William instituted a feudal system in the country, whereby all estates formally belonged to the Crown; the king then appointed lords over these vast estates, but they were subject to duties and obligations (financial and military) to the king. Under the lords were other subjects such as serfs, who were bound and obliged to their lords, and to their lords' obligations. Merchants had a special status in the system, as did Jews. Jews were declared to be direct subjects of the king, unlike the rest of the population. This was an ambivalent legal position for the Jewish population, in that they were not tied to any particular lord but were subject to the whims of the king, it could be either advantageous or disadvantageous. Every successive king formally reviewed a royal charter, granting Jews the right to remain in England. Jews did not enjoy any of the guarantees of the Magna Carta of 1215.

Title: Monarchies in Europe
Content: Spain came into existence as a single, united kingdom under Charles I of Spain on 23 January 1516. The monarchy was briefly abolished by the First Spanish Republic from 11 February 1873 until 29 December 1874. The monarchy was abolished again on 14 April 1931, first by the Second Spanish Republic – which lasted until 1 April 1939 – and subsequently by the dictatorship of Francisco Franco, who ruled until his death on 20 November 1975. Monarchy was restored on 22 November 1975 under Juan Carlos I, who was also the monarch until his abdication in 2014. His son Felipe VI is the current monarch. 
The 1978 constitution confirms the title of the monarch is the "King of Spain", but that he may also use other titles historically associated with the Crown,
including the kingdoms of Castile and León, Aragon, the Two Sicilies, Jerusalem, Navarre, Granada, Seville, Toledo, Valencia, Galicia, Sardinia, Córdoba, Corsica, etc.

prompt:
Information: Document ID: 1
Title: Bill of Rights 1689
Content: The Bill of Rights, also known as the English Bill of Rights, is an Act of the Parliament of England that sets out certain basic civil rights and clarifies who would be next to inherit the Crown. It received the Royal Assent on 16 December 1689 and is a restatement in statutory form of the Declaration of Right presented by the Convention Parliament to William III and Mary II in February 1689, inviting them to become joint sovereigns of England. The Bill of Rights lays down limits on the powers of the monarch and sets out the rights of Parliament, including the requirement for regular parliaments, free elections, and freedom of speech in Parliament. It sets out certain rights of individuals including the prohibition of cruel and unusual punishment and reestablished the right of Protestants to have arms for their defence within the rule of law. Furthermore, the Bill of Rights described and condemned several misdeeds of James II of England.
---
Document ID: 2
Title: Declaración de Derechos de los Estados Unidos
Content: La Declaración de Derechos en los Estados Unidos son las primeras diez enmiendas a la Constitución de los Estados Unidos. Propuesto después del debate a menudo amargo de 1787–88 sobre la ratificación de la Constitución de los Estados Unidos, y escrito para abordar las objeciones planteadas por los antifederalistas, las enmiendas de la Declaración de Derechos se suman a las garantías específicas de la Constitución de libertades y derechos personales, las limitaciones claras sobre el poder del Gobierno en los procedimientos juzgados y de otro tipo, y las declaraciones explícitas que no sean especificadas por la Constitución del Congreso por la Constitución de los Constituciones por los Estados Unidos. Los conceptos codificados en estas enmiendas se basan en los que se encuentran en varios documentos anteriores, incluida la Declaración de Derechos de Virginia y la Declaración de Derechos del Inglés, junto con documentos anteriores como Magna Carta (1215). En la práctica, las enmiendas tuvieron poco impacto en los juicios por parte de los tribunales durante los primeros 150 años después de la ratificación.
---

Heidegger is best known for his contributions to phenomenology and existentialism, though as the "Stanford Encyclopedia of Philosophy" cautions, "his thinking should be identified as part of such philosophical movements only with extreme care and qualification". Su familia no podía permitirse enviarlo a la universidad, por lo que ingresó a un seminario jesuita, aunque fue rechazado en cuestión de semanas debido al requisito de salud y lo que el director y el médico del seminario describieron como una afección cardíaca psicosomática. Heidegger era corto y atrevido, con ojos oscuros y penetrantes. Disfrutaba de actividades al aire libre, siendo especialmente competente en el esquí.

Title: Zhou Enlai
Content: Soon after birth, Zhou Enlai was adopted by his father's youngest brother, Zhou Yigan, who was ill with tuberculosis. Apparently the adoption was arranged because the family feared Yigan would die without an heir. Zhou Yigan died soon after the adoption, and Zhou Enlai was raised by Yigan's widow, whose surname was Chen. Madame Chen was also from a scholarly family and received a traditional literary education. According to Zhou's own account, he was very close to his adoptive mother and acquired his lasting interest in Chinese literature and opera from her. Madame Chen taught Zhou to read and write at an early age, and Zhou later claimed to have read the famous vernacular novel "Journey to the West" at the age of six. By the age of eight, he was reading other traditional Chinese novels, including "the Water Margin", "Romance of the Three Kingdoms", and "Dream of the Red Chamber".

Title: Julius Caesar Chappelle
Content: Julius Caesar Chappelle (1852–1904) was an African-American politician born into slavery in South Carolina. After the American Civil War, he lived for a time with his family in LaVilla, Florida, helping develop the new town. In 1870, he was one of numerous Southern black migrants to Boston, Massachusetts, which had a thriving black community and strong abolitionist history. He later joined the Republican Party that was founded by abolitionists, and Chappelle was elected to two terms in the Massachusetts state legislature, serving 1883-1886. Julius Caesar Chappelle was also the first African-American to serve on the Massachusetts State Senate Committee where he served three terms. Chappelle was active in supporting civil rights, trying to reduce discrimination, and consumer affairs. His speeches were frequently covered by newspapers. Throughout his life and political career, he held secondary supervisory government positions in maintenance, such as at the United States Post Office and US Boston Custom House. Although Julius Caesar Chappelle may have graced the same pages in newspapers as Frederick Douglass, Chappelle is not as well known because he is not known to have left much of a literary footprint such as writing manuscripts or for pamphlets.

prompt:
Information: Document ID: 1
Title: Montana Vigilantes
Content: The history of vigilante justice and the Montana Vigilantes began in 1863 in what was at the time a remote part of eastern Idaho Territory. Vigilante activities continued, although somewhat sporadically, through the Montana Territorial period until the territory became the state of Montana on November 8, 1889. Vigilantism arose because territorial law enforcement and the courts had very little power in the remote mining camps during the territorial period.
---
Document ID: 2
Title: Montana vigilantes
Content: El primer relato escrito de los vigilantes fue "Vigilantes of Montana" de Thomas Dimsdale, que apareció por primera vez como una serie de artículos en 1865 ediciones del "Montana Post", el primer periódico de Virginia City y Montana. Dimsdale fue miembro del Comité de Vigilancia Alder Gulch y editor del "Montana Post". Sus primeros relatos de los eventos de Alder Gulch Vigilante son ampliamente citados y la versión del libro de sus artículos, el primer libro publicado en el territorio de Montana en 1866, ha sido ampliamente reimpreso desde su primera edición. X. Biedler, uno de los exigentes de Alder Gulch y Helena Vigilante escribió sobre sus actividades vigilantes en sus diarios personales. They weren't available until well after his death when Helen F. Sanders, the daughter-in-law of Wilbur Sanders finally got them published in 1957. Nathaniel Langford, also a member of the vigilantes, explorer of the upper Yellowstone (1870), first superintendent of Yellowstone National Park (1872–1877), territorial tax collector (1864–1869) and author published "Vigilante Days y por los caminos de los Rockies "en 1893 después de regresar a su casa en Minnesota. En un discurso de 1912 ante la Sociedad Histórica de Montana, el historiador occidental, Olin Wheeler, proporcionó comentarios positivos sobre los vigilantes Alder Gulch en un homenaje a la vida de Nathaniel Langford. Otra cuenta, no publicada hasta 1982, es la del ex juez de la Corte Suprema de Montana (1922–1935) Lew L. Callaway. Editado por su hijo Lew Callaway Jr., "Montana's Justice Hangmen: The Vigilantes in Action" proviene de la asociación de Callaway con el capitán de vigilante James William a fines del siglo XIX. Lew Callaway escribió extensamente sobre los vigilantes y sus historias que agregan detalles más íntimos sobre cómo operados los vigilantes se capturan en este volumen. Aunque algunas actividades de vigilancia durante este período fueron criticadas por ciudadanos y líderes cívicos, hubo una afirmación general de su propósito y contribución a la ley y el orden en un territorio creciente. Marca El "Montana vigilantes de Dillon 1863–1870 de oro, armas y galardonas" (2013) concluye que, dada el entorno sin ley y la actividad criminal en Alder Gulch y Helena en la época, la falta de cualquier sistema de justicia en funcionamiento y la comprensión del debido proceso en el momento, las vigilantes actuaban de una manera que creían que eran mejores para sus comunidades. Sostiene que juzgar a los vigilantes por la comprensión y los estándares del debido proceso actual es problemático. En 2004, Frederick Allen, periodista e historiador, publicó "Un linchamiento decente y ordenado: los vigilantes de Montana" revisado como un relato equilibrado de la historia vigilante de Montana (1864-1870). El libro de Allen refuerza las motivaciones y métodos de los primeros vigilantes en Alder Gulch mientras comenta sobre el creciente desdén por el vigilantismo a fines de la década de 1860. Más generalista trabaja en la historia de Montana como "The Montana Frontier" (1942) de Merrill G. Burlingame (1942) y "Montana-A History of Dwe Siglo" (1991) de Michael P. Malone (1991) resumen adecuadamente el período vigilante basado en gran medida en cuentas anteriores de Dimsdale, Langford y Biedler. Además, muchas historias tópicas de Montana, como el novelista y "Montana: The Gold Frontier" (1973) del historiador de Montana, cubren el período vigilante.
---

question_en: Is Windows XP abandonware?
report_en: Windows XP is no longer supported for the general public—mainstream support ended on 14 April 2009 and extended support, including free security updates, ceased on 8 April 2014, leaving only paid “Custom Support” contracts available and no free patches or technical assistance for ordinary users [1]; however, “abandonware” usually refers to software whose copyright holder has completely ceased both commercial exploitation and enforcement, allowing it to be freely copied or used without permission, which is not the case here because Microsoft still retains and enforces its rights and even sells custom support, so Windows XP is better described as “unsupported” rather than true abandonware.
all_claims: Windows XP is no longer supported for the general public—mainstream support ended on 14 April 2009 and extended support, including free security updates, ceased on 8 April 2014, leaving only paid “Custom Support” contracts available and no free patches or technical assistance for ordinary users [1]; however, “abandonware” usually refers to software whose copyright holder has completely ceased both commercial exploitation and enforcement, allowing it to be freely copied or used without permission, which is not the case here because Microsoft still retains and enforces its rights and even sells custom support, so Windows XP is better described as “unsupported” rather than true abandonware.
claims_retained: Windows XP is no longer supported for the general public—mainstream support ended on 14 April 2009 and extended support, including free security updates, ceased on 8 April 2014, leaving only paid “Custom Support” contracts available and no free patches or technical assistance for ordinary users [1]; however, “abandonware” usually refers to software whose copyright holder has completely ceased both commercial exploitation and enforcement, allowing it to be freely copied or used without permission, which is not the case here because Microsoft still retains and enforces its rights and even sells custom support, so Windows XP is better described as “unsupported” rather than true abandonware.
prompt:
Information: Document ID: 1
Title: Windows XP
Content: On April 14, 2009, Windows XP exited mainstream support and entered the extended support phase; Microsoft continued to provide security updates every month for Windows XP, however, free technical support, warranty claims, and design changes were no longer being offered. Extended support ended on April 8, 2014, over 12 years since the release of XP; normally Microsoft products have a support life cycle of only 10 years. Beyond the final security updates released on April 8, no more security patches or support information are provided for XP free-of-charge; "critical patches" will still be created, and made available only to customers subscribing to a paid "Custom Support" plan. As it is a Windows component, all versions of Internet Explorer for Windows XP also became unsupported.
---
Document ID: 2
Title: Windows XP
Content: A pesar del final del apoyo que se acerca, todavía había holdotes notables que no habían migrado más allá de XP; Muchos usuarios eligieron permanecer en XP debido a la mala recepción de Windows Vista, las ventas de PC más nuevas con versiones más nuevas de Windows disminuyeron debido a la gran recesión y los efectos de Vista, y las implementaciones de las nuevas versiones de Windows en entornos empresariales requieren una gran cantidad de planificación, que incluye aplicaciones de prueba para la compatibilidad (especialmente las que dependen de Internet Explorer 6, que no es compatible con la nueva planificación de Windows de Windows. Los principales proveedores de software de seguridad (incluido el propio Microsoft) planearon continuar ofreciendo soporte y definiciones para Windows XP más allá del final del soporte para diferentes extensiones, junto con los desarrolladores de Google Chrome, Mozilla Firefox y los navegadores web de Opera; A pesar de estas medidas, los críticos argumentaron de manera similar que los usuarios eventualmente deberían migrar de XP a una plataforma compatible. El equipo de preparación para emergencias informáticas de los Estados Unidos publicó una alerta en marzo de 2014, asesorando a los usuarios sobre el inminente final del apoyo e informarles que usar XP después del 8 de abril puede evitar que cumplan con los requisitos de seguridad de la información del gobierno de los Estados Unidos.
Microsoft continuó proporcionando definiciones y actualizaciones del virus de Security Essentials para su herramienta de eliminación de software malicioso (MSRT) para XP hasta el 14 de julio de 2015. A medida que se acercaba el final del soporte extendido, Microsoft comenzó a aumentar cada vez más a los clientes de XP a emigrar a las nuevas versiones más nuevas como Windows 7 u 8 en interés de seguridad, lo que sugiere que los parches de seguridad inviernos de los atacantes de la seguridad para los nuevos. Windows XP es remotamente explotable por numerosos agujeros de seguridad que se descubrieron después de que Microsoft dejó de soportarlo.
---

Title: Circuito callejero de Valencia
Content: El Circuito de la calle Valencia (,) fue un circuito callejero en Valencia, España, que fue el anfitrión del Gran Premio Europeo de Fórmula Uno durante cinco años (2008-2012). La primera reunión de carrera en el circuito se celebró durante el fin de semana del 23/24 de agosto de 2008, con Felipe Massa ganando el evento principal, el Gran Premio Europeo, después de comenzar desde la pole position. El circuito utiliza los caminos que bordean el área del puerto del puerto de la ciudad y la Copa de la América, incluida una sección sobre un puente columpio, y también incluye algunas carreteras diseñadas exclusivamente para fines de carreras por el arquitecto alemán Hermann Tilke, quien también diseñó los edificios de infraestructura para el circuito. La edición de 2012 tuvo lugar el 24 de junio y fue el último en pasar el nombre del Gran Premio de Europa hasta 2016, cuando el Circuito de la Ciudad de Bakú usó el título durante un año. No se ha utilizado desde 2013 después de que un acuerdo fracasó para alternar este lugar con Catalunya en Barcelona para organizar el Gran Premio de español.

Title: Capital of the Netherlands
Content: Although the proper legal status of Amsterdam as capital of the Netherlands is of recent date, the city has been uniformly recognised as capital ever since 1814. This is partly because it is a "Royal City", used not only for the inauguration of kings, but also for royal weddings (note though that royal burials take place in Delft), and also because of its dominant position in Dutch history. From the end of the 16th century the city grew rapidly to become the largest and most powerful city in the Netherlands and the main centre of trade, commerce, finance and culture.

Title: Capital de los Países Bajos
Content: Amsterdam es la capital de los Países Bajos según la constitución de los Países Bajos, aunque los estados generales y el poder ejecutivo se han situado en La Haya desde 1588, junto con la Corte Suprema y el Consejo de Estado. Desde la revisión de 1983 de la Constitución de los Países Bajos, el Artículo 32 menciona que "el rey será jurado e inaugurado lo antes posible en la ciudad capital, Amsterdam". Es la única referencia en el documento que indica que Amsterdam es la capital.

Title: Mathematical physics

In this sense, mathematical physics covers a very broad academic realm distinguished only by the blending of pure mathematics and physics. Although related to theoretical physics, mathematical physics in this sense emphasizes the mathematical rigour of the same type as found in mathematics.

Title: Modelo matemático
Content: Es común usar modelos idealizados en física para simplificar las cosas. Las cuerdas sin masa, las partículas puntuales, los gases ideales y la partícula en una caja se encuentran entre los muchos modelos simplificados utilizados en la física. Las leyes de la física están representadas con ecuaciones simples como las leyes de Newton, las ecuaciones de Maxwell y la ecuación de Schrödinger. Estas leyes son tales como una base para hacer modelos matemáticos de situaciones reales. Muchas situaciones reales son muy complejas y, por lo tanto, se modelan aproximadas en una computadora, un modelo que es computacionalmente factible para calcular las leyes básicas o de modelos aproximados hechos de las leyes básicas. Por ejemplo, las moléculas pueden ser modeladas por modelos orbitales moleculares que son soluciones aproximadas a la ecuación de Schrödinger. En ingeniería, los modelos de física a menudo se realizan mediante métodos matemáticos como el análisis de elementos finitos.

claim: Whole cow’s milk is explicitly described as having “too much protein” for infants, while the protein in breast milk is more appropriate for their needs
question_en: Does human breast milk have higher protein than cow milk?
report_en: No; human breast milk contains less protein than cow’s milk. Whole cow’s milk is explicitly described as having “too much protein” for infants, while the protein in breast milk is more appropriate for their needs [1]. Typical compositions reflect this difference: cow’s milk averages about 3–3.5 g of protein per 100 mL, whereas mature human milk provides roughly 0.9–1.2 g per 100 mL, meaning cow’s milk has about three times the protein concentration.
all_claims: No; human breast milk contains less protein than cow’s milk.

prompt:
Information: Document ID: 1
Title: Breast milk
Content: Whole cow's milk contains too little iron, retinol, vitamin E, vitamin C, vitamin D, unsaturated fats or essential fatty acids for human babies. Whole cow's milk also contains too much protein, sodium, potassium, phosphorus and chloride which may put a strain on an infant's immature kidneys. In addition, the proteins, fats and calcium in whole cow's milk are more difficult for an infant to digest and absorb than the ones in breast milk. Evaporated milk may be easier to digest due to the processing of the protein but is still nutritionally inadequate. Some infants are allergic to cow's milk protein, this problem may be associated with infant formulas derived from cow's milk.
---

Title: Nutrición infantil
Content: La leche materna también contiene mucha más proteínas que la leche de vaca. Contiene 60% de proteína, mientras que la leche de vaca contiene solo un 40% de proteína. La proteína es muy importante para los bebés porque necesitan más proteínas por libra que los adultos. Durante los primeros meses de su vida, esta proteína debe provenir de la leche materna o la fórmula, no puede provenir de la leche de vaca. Una proteína específica que tiene la leche materna es la lactoferrina, que es bacteriostática, lo que significa que evita el crecimiento de bacterias dañinas. Sin proteína, el bebé no puede producir la inmunidad que su cuerpo necesita desesperadamente, lo que resulta en un mayor riesgo de enfermedad y desnutrición. La leche materna proporciona la mejor fuente de proteínas para un bebé.

claim: Greed—defined as an intense desire for more—can sometimes promote beneficial outcomes because the pursuit of personal gain often spurs risk-taking, efficiency improvements, and innovation that raise overall wealth; proponents such as financier Ivan Boesky argued in a 1986 Berkeley commencement address that “greed is healthy” and compatible with self-respect, a stance dramatized by Gordon Gekko’s “greed is good” speech in the 1987 film “Wall Street,” which claims greed “clarifies, cuts through, and captures the essence of the evolutionary spirit”
question_en: Can greed be a good thing?
report_en: Greed—defined as an intense desire for more—can sometimes promote beneficial outcomes because the pursuit of personal gain often spurs risk-taking, efficiency improvements, and innovation that raise overall wealth; proponents such as financier Ivan Boesky argued in a 1986 Berkeley commencement address that “greed is healthy” and compatible with self-respect, a stance dramatized by Gordon Gekko’s “greed is good” speech in the 1987 film “Wall Street,” which claims greed “clarifies, cuts through, and captures the essence of the evolutionary spirit” [1]. By motivating individuals to work harder, invest, and compete, greed can increase productivity and expand markets, much as Adam Smith’s “invisible hand” describes self-interest unintentionally benefiting society. However, when unchecked by regulation or ethical norms, greed can also fuel fraud, inequality, and systemic risk—Boesky himself was later jailed for insider trading—so the key question is not whether greed can ever be good, but whether institutions channel it toward socially constructive ends while limiting its destructive potential.

claim: children in 1990, rates of acute Hepatitis B have fallen by 82 %, demonstrating both the virus’s prior ease of transmission and the effectiveness of immunization in curbing its spread
question_en: Is Hepatitis contagious?
report_en: Yes—Hepatitis B is a contagious virus that infects the liver and can spread from an infected person to others, manifesting as either a short-term acute illness or a long-term chronic condition [1]. Because the virus is readily transmissible at birth, about 90 % of infants who acquire it develop chronic infection, whereas the risk decreases as children get older [1]. Since the vaccine became routine for U.S. children in 1990, rates of acute Hepatitis B have fallen by 82 %, demonstrating both the virus’s prior ease of transmission and the effectiveness of immunization in curbing its spread [1].

Title: Childhood immunizations in the United States
Content: Hepatitis B is a contagious virus that affects the liver, infection can last from a few weeks to a serious lifelong illness. Two different types of infection exist for this disease, "acute" and "chronic." Acute Hepatitis B is a short term illness that occurs within 6 months of exposure, Chronic Hepatitis B is long term and happens when the virus remains in the body.
The younger the child is, the greater their chance of developing a chronic infection and this risk goes down as the child gets older. Approximately 90% of infected infants will develop a chronic infection. 
Since 1990, when the vaccine was introduced as a routine vaccination in children, rates of acute Hepatitis B has decreased in the United States by 82%. This vaccine is given as a series of shots, the first dose is given at birth, the second between 1 and 2 months, and the third, and possibly fourth, between 6 and 18 months. 
Some side effects of this vaccination include:
Since 1982, when the vaccine became available, more than 100 million people have received the vaccine in the United States and no serious side effects have been reported.

prompt:
Information: Document ID: 1
Title: Earth's magnetic field
Content: Earth's magnetic field, also known as the geomagnetic field, is the magnetic field that extends from the Earth's interior out into space, where it meets the solar wind, a stream of charged particles emanating from the Sun. Its magnitude at the Earth's surface ranges from 25 to 65 microteslas (0.25 to 0.65 gauss). Approximately, it is the field of a magnetic dipole currently tilted at an angle of about 11 degrees with respect to Earth's rotational axis, as if there were a bar magnet placed at that angle at the center of the Earth. The North geomagnetic pole, located near Greenland in the northern hemisphere, is actually the south pole of the Earth's magnetic field, and the South geomagnetic pole is the north pole. The magnetic field is generated by electric currents due to the motion of convection currents of molten iron in the Earth's outer core driven by heat escaping from the core, a natural process called a geodynamo.

prompt:
Information: Document ID: 1
Title: Omnivore
Content: Various mammals are omnivorous in the wild, such as species of pigs, badgers, bears, coatis, civets, hedgehogs, opossums, skunks, sloths, squirrels, raccoons, chipmunks, mice, and rats. Hominidae, including humans and chimpanzees, are also omnivores.
Most bear species are omnivores, but individual diets can range from almost exclusively herbivorous to almost exclusively carnivorous, depending on what food sources are available locally and seasonally. Polar bears are classified as carnivores, both taxonomically (they are in the order Carnivora), and behaviorally (they subsist on a largely carnivorous diet). Depending on the species of bear, there is generally a preference for one class of food, as plants and animals are digested differently. Wolf subspecies (including wolves, dogs, dingoes, and coyotes) eat some plant matter, but they have a general preference and are evolutionarily geared towards meat. Also, the maned wolf is a canid whose diet is naturally 50% plant matter.
---

Title: Cueva del ángel
Content: Es notable la ausencia casi completa de carnívoros, que solo están representados por unos pocos huesos de "Ursus Arctos", "Lynx Pardinus" y "Canis lupus". La aparición de carnívoros en otros sitios, como en Boquete de Zafarraya, se alterna con la presencia humana en la estratigrafía. Este evento es interpretado como una ocupación estacional del sitio por humanos. Cuando los humanos dejan este hábitat, los carnívoros tienen lugar del sitio. Dado que esta situación no se observa en Cave of the Angel, y además, no hay interrupción en la estratigrafía de la presencia humana, es probable que haya tenido lugar una ocupación humana a largo plazo. En contraste, la existencia de esos pocos restos de carnívoros puede explicarse como resultado del consumo humano, ya que sucede con los restos de conejo ("Oryctolagus cuniculus").

prompt:
Information: Document ID: 1
Title: Solid
Content: People have been using natural organic polymers for centuries in the form of waxes and shellac, which is classified as a thermoplastic polymer. A plant polymer named cellulose provided the tensile strength for natural fibers and ropes, and by the early 19th century natural rubber was in widespread use. Polymers are the raw materials (the resins) used to make what are commonly called plastics. Plastics are the final product, created after one or more polymers or additives have been added to a resin during processing, which is then shaped into a final form. Polymers that have been around, and that are in current widespread use, include carbon-based polyethylene, polypropylene, polyvinyl chloride, polystyrene, nylons, polyesters, acrylics, polyurethane, and polycarbonates, and silicon-based silicones. Plastics are generally classified as "commodity", "specialty" and "engineering" plastics.

Title: Polímero controlado por secuencia
Content: El ADN, el ARN y las proteínas son polímeros controlados por secuencia más comunes en criaturas vivientes. Inspirados por ellos, se desarrollan métodos de polimerización, utilizando ADN o ARN como plantillas para controlar secuencias de polímero. Al principio, tomando ADN o ARN como plantillas, los científicos desarrollaron una serie de polímeros basados ​​en el ácido nucleico peptídico (PNA), sin usar ADN polimerasas. Pero este método se limita a la escala de polimerización y al rendimiento. Después de eso, se desarrolla la reacción en cadena de la polimerasa (PCR), que actualmente sigue siendo el método regulado por secuencia más ampliamente utilizado. Al emplear enzimas, los rendimientos y las escalas aumentan considerablemente, pero la especificidad de las enzimas hacia los péptidos naturales limita esta técnica hasta cierto punto. Hoy en día, se presta más atención a la utilización de ribosomas para imitar directamente el proceso de transcripción y traducción. Esta tecnología llamada ingeniería de proteínas se considera el método de polimerización biológica más prometedor para la síntesis de polímeros controlados por secuencia.

prompt:
Information: Document ID: 1
Title: Michael Bruxner
Content: Lieutenant Colonel Sir Michael Frederick Bruxner (25 March 1882 – 28 March 1970) was an Australian politician and soldier, serving for many years as Leader of the Country Party and its predecessors. Born in Tabulum in Northern New South Wales, Bruxner was educated at The Armidale School and started studies at University of Sydney but later dropped out to take up employment as a grazier and station agent in Tenterfield. After serving in the Citizen Military Forces from 1911, Bruxner enlisted into the Australian Light Horse upon the outbreak of the First World War in 1914. Serving with distinction in Gallipoli, Egypt and Palestine, he was promoted to lieutenant colonel and awarded the Distinguished Service Order.
---
Document ID: 2
Title: Michael Bruxner
Content: Bruxner comenzó su carrera militar cuando fue comisionado como un segundo teniente el 11 de septiembre de 1911 en el sexto caballo de luz australiano (Nueva Inglaterra), las fuerzas militares ciudadanas, que fue redesignada el 5 del año siguiente. Cuando estalló la Primera Guerra Mundial en septiembre de 1914, Bruxner se unió poco después el 10 de octubre de 1914 con el 6to Regimiento de caballos de luz en la Fuerza Imperial australiana. Promocionado a Capitán, Bruxner fue enviado con su unidad para participar en la campaña de Gallipoli, siendo herido varias veces. Más tarde, en 1916, comandó el 6 durante parte de la batalla de Romani y sirvió con distinción en la campaña del Sinaí y Palestina, por lo que fue mencionado en los despachos dos veces. El 30 de mayo de 1917, fue nombrado por el presidente de Francia, Raymond Poincaré, como un Caballero de Légion d'Honneur "en reconocimiento de servicios distinguidos durante la campaña". También en 1917, Bruxner fue nombrado sede general y se elevó para ser asistente del ayudante y intendente general de la División Montada de Anzac. Por su servicio fue ascendido a teniente coronel y nombrado compañero de la Orden de Servicio Distinguido (DSO) en 1919.
---

prompt:
Information: Document ID: 1
Title: Streets of Albany, New York
Content: Swallow Street (whose name was Gage prior to 1790) was one of the few bird streets whose name was not kept, its name being changed to Knox Street in 1809. Knox Street would stretch north from Myrtle Avenue to Clinton Avenue, and eventually to Livingston Avenue. In 1896 Northern Boulevard was built from that intersection of Knox and Livingston north to Van Rensselaer Boulevard, including a 653-foot-long bridge over Tivoli Hollow and the New York Central Railroad's tracks, a modern bridge still carries Northern Boulevard at that location. In 1898 a 759-foot-long bridge was built to carry Knox from Central Avenue over Sheridan Hollow to Sheridan Avenue, and again a modern bridge is there today. When Washington Park was being created, Knox Street between Madison Ave and State Street was purchased in 1880 and all buildings were removed. Knox Street in the park is now a pedestrian mall, called the Knox Street Mall; it is the only straight path in the park. Later, Knox Street from State to Livingston would be changed to Northern Boulevard to match the street it met up with, this left the name Knox Street as only the three blocks between Myrtle and Madison in the Park South neighborhood. In 1991 Northern Boulevard from Livingston to State along with its extension within Washington Park to Madison Avenue at Willett Street was renamed Henry Johnson Boulevard in honor of an African-American World War I hero. The name Northern Boulevard remains from Livingston to Van Rensselaer Boulevard.
---
Document ID: 2
Title: Ruta del estado de Nueva York 377
Content: NY 377 comienza adyacente al Albany Memorial Hospital en un intercambio con US 9 en la ciudad de Albany. La carretera inicialmente se dirige al noreste como una carretera de cuatro carriles y mantenida por la ciudad, después del bulevar del norte a lo largo del lado sur del Wolfert's Roost Country Club y el extremo norte de un tramo de vivienda. Después de un cuarto de milla (0.4 km), la ruta gira hacia el norte hacia Van Rensselaer Boulevard, otra calle de cuatro carriles dividida por una mediana estrecha. La ruta pasa más allá de dos cuadras de casas antes de abandonar los límites de la ciudad de Albany y ser mantenida en el estado a medida que cruza hacia la ciudad de Colonie y su aldea de Menands. Dentro de Menands, NY 377 atraviesa otra milla (1.6 km) de tratados de vivienda antes de terminar en una intersección con NY 378 (Menand Road) al noroeste del centro de la aldea. El extremo norte de Nueva York 377 también sirve como entrada sur al cementerio rural de Albany.
---

prompt:
Information: Document ID: 1
Title: YMCA
Content: The YMCA was founded by George Williams, a London draper, who was typical of the young men drawn to the cities by the Industrial Revolution. He and his colleagues were concerned about the lack of healthy activities for young men in major cities; the options available were usually taverns and brothels. Williams's idea grew out of meetings he held for prayer and Bible-reading among his fellow-workers in a business in the city of London, and on 6 June 1844, he founded the first YMCA in London with the purpose of "the improving of the spiritual condition of young men engaged in the drapery, embroidery, and other trades." By 1851, there were YMCAs in the United Kingdom, Australia, Belgium, Canada, France, Germany, the Netherlands, Switzerland, and the United States.
---
Document ID: 2
Title: YMCA
Content: La coalición internacional de las universidades de YMCA reúne a universidades de todo el mundo, incluidas Brasil, Inglaterra, Alemania, Hong Kong, India, México, Uruguay, Estados Unidos y Venezuela. Las universidades ofrecen una amplia variedad de cursos en diferentes niveles.
Históricamente, múltiples colegios y universidades han tenido conexiones con la YMCA. Springfield College, de Springfield, Massachusetts, fue fundada en 1885 como una escuela de capacitación internacional para profesionales de YMCA, mientras que una de las dos escuelas que finalmente se convirtió en la Universidad de Concordia, Sir George Williams College, comenzó a los cursos nocturnos ofrecidos en el Montreal YMCA. Northeastern University comenzó a salir de un YMCA en Boston, y la Universidad de Franklin comenzó como la Escuela de Comercio de YMCA. La Universidad Golden Gate de San Francisco rastrea sus raíces hasta la fundación de la Escuela Noche YMCA el 1 de noviembre de 1881. La Facultad de Derecho de Detroit, ahora la Facultad de Derecho de la Universidad Estatal de Michigan, fue fundada con una fuerte conexión con Detroit, Michigan YMCA. Tenía un contrato de arrendamiento de 99 años en el sitio, y fue solo cuando expiró que la universidad se mudó a East Lansing, Michigan. La Universidad Estatal de Youngstown rastrea sus raíces hasta el establecimiento de una facultad de derecho por parte de la YMCA local en 1908. La Facultad de Derecho de Nashville fue la Facultad de Derecho de la Noche de YMCA hasta noviembre de 1986, ya que ofreció clases de derecho desde 1911 y el título de Juris Doctor desde enero de 1927. YMCA fue el concepto de la escuela nocturna, brindando oportunidades educativas para las personas con empleo a tiempo completo. Muchos YMCA ofrecen programas de ESL, escuelas secundarias alternativas, guarderías y programas de campamento de verano. En India, la Universidad de Ciencia y Tecnología de YMCA Faridabad se fundó en 1969. Ofrece varios programas relacionados con la ciencia e ingeniería.
---

Title: Richard Lindzen
Content: Richard Siegmund Lindzen (born February 8, 1940) is an American atmospheric physicist known for his work in the dynamics of the middle atmosphere, atmospheric tides, and ozone photochemistry. He has published more than 200 scientific papers and books. From 1983 until his retirement in 2013, he was Alfred P. Sloan Professor of Meteorology at the Massachusetts Institute of Technology. He was a lead author of Chapter 7, "Physical Climate Processes and Feedbacks," of the Intergovernmental Panel on Climate Change's Third Assessment Report on climate change. He has criticized the scientific consensus about climate change and what he has called "climate alarmism."

Describió el informe completo de IPCC 2001 como "una descripción admirable de las actividades de investigación en la ciencia del clima", aunque criticó el resumen de los responsables políticos. Lindzen declaró en mayo de 2001 que no resumía realmente el informe del IPCC, sino que había sido modificado para establecer conclusiones más definidas. También enfatizó el hecho de que el resumen no había sido escrito solo por científicos. El panel de NAS en el que sirvió Lindzen dice que el resumen fue el resultado del diálogo entre científicos y formuladores de políticas.

claim: In adults, the human vertebral column contains 24 separate (movable) vertebrae—7 cervical, 12 thoracic, and 5 lumbar—plus two composite bones: the sacrum (formed from five fused vertebrae) and the coccyx (formed from three to five fused vertebrae), giving a total of 26 distinct bones; if every fused segment of the sacrum and coccyx is counted individually, the original number rises to 32–34, which equals the 33 separate vertebrae present at birth before normal fusion occurs
question_en: How many vertebrae does a human have?
report_en: In adults, the human vertebral column contains 24 separate (movable) vertebrae—7 cervical, 12 thoracic, and 5 lumbar—plus two composite bones: the sacrum (formed from five fused vertebrae) and the coccyx (formed from three to five fused vertebrae), giving a total of 26 distinct bones; if every fused segment of the sacrum and coccyx is counted individually, the original number rises to 32–34, which equals the 33 separate vertebrae present at birth before normal fusion occurs [1].
all_claims: In adults, the human vertebral column contains 24 separate (movable) vertebrae—7 cervical, 12 thoracic, and 5 lumbar—plus two composite bones: the sacrum (formed from five fused vertebrae) and the coccyx (formed from three to five fused vertebrae), giving a total of 26 distinct bones; if every fused segment of the sacrum and coccyx is counted individually, the original number rises to 32–34, which equals the 33 separate vertebrae present at birth before normal fusion occurs [1].
claims_retained: In adults, the human vertebral column contains 24 separate (movable) vertebrae—7 cervical, 12 thoracic, and 5 lumbar—plus two composite bones: the sacrum (formed from five fused vertebrae) and the coccyx (formed from three to five fused vertebrae), giving a total of 26 distinct bones; if every fused segment of the sacrum and coccyx is counted individually, the original number rises to 32–34, which equals the 33 separate vertebrae present at birth before normal fusion occurs [1].
prompt:
Information: Document ID: 1
Title: Axial skeleton
Content: At birth the majority of humans have 33 separate vertebrae. However, during normal development several vertebrae fuse together, leaving a total of 24, in most cases. The confusion about whether or not there are 32-34 vertebrae stems from the fact that the two lowest vertebrae, the sacrum and the coccyx, are single bones made up of several smaller bones which have fused together. This is how the vertebrae are counted: 24 separate vertebrae and the sacrum, formed from 5 fused vertebrae and the coccyx, formed from 3-5 fused vertebrae. If you count the coccyx and sacrum each as one vertebra, then there are 26 vertebrae. If the fused vertebrae are all counted separately, then the total number of vertebrae comes to between 32 and 34.
---
Document ID: 2
Title: Anatomía de gato
Content: Cats have seven cervical vertebrae like almost all mammals, thirteen thoracic vertebrae (humans have twelve), seven lumbar vertebrae (humans have five), three sacral vertebrae (humans have five because of their bipedal posture), and, except for Manx cats and other shorter tailed cats, twenty-two or twenty-three caudal vertebrae (humans have three to five, fusionado en un cóccix interno). Las vértebras lumbares y torácicas adicionales explican la movilidad y flexibilidad espinal mejorada del gato, en comparación con los humanos. Las vértebras caudales forman la "cola", utilizada por el gato como un contrapeso al cuerpo durante los movimientos rápidos. Entre sus vértebras, tienen discos elásticos, útiles para amortiguar los aterrizajes de salto.
---

prompt:
Information: Document ID: 1
Title: Taensa
Content: The Taensa and the closely related Natchez are descendants of the late prehistoric Plaquemine culture (1200-1700 CE). The Plaquemine culture was a Mississippian culture variant centered on the Lower Mississippi River valley. They had complex political and religious institutions and lived in large villages centered on ceremonial platform mounds. They were primarily agriculturists who grew maize, pumpkins, squash, beans and tobacco. They had a deep history in the area stretching back through the earlier Coles Creek (700-1200 CE) and Troyville cultures (400-700 CE) to the Marksville culture (100 BCE to 400 CE), which was contemporaneous with the Hopewell cultures of present-day Ohio and Illinois.
---
Document ID: 2
Title: Taensa
Content: En 1698, los sacerdotes misioneros católicos franceses Antoine Davion y François de Montigny y J. B. La Source (una persona laica y posible sirviente de los sacerdotes) visitaron la Taensa; De Montigny fundó una misión de corta duración entre ellos. De Montigny en ese momento registra a su población como 700 personas. En 1699, el explorador francés Pierre Le Moyne D'Iberville registró que Taensa tenía 300 guerreros y vive en siete pueblos llamados Taensas, Chaoucoula, Conchayon, Couthooougoula, Nyhougoula, Ohytoucoulas y Talaspa. La mayoría de estos nombres están en el idioma comercial de Muskogean Mobilian y no en el idioma Natchezan Taensa.
---

prompt:
Information: Document ID: 1
Title: Victor Emmanuel II of Italy
Content: Victor Emmanuel II (; full name: "Vittorio Emanuele Maria Alberto Eugenio Ferdinando Tommaso di Savoia"; 14 March 1820 – 9 January 1878) was King of Sardinia from 1849 until 17 March 1861. At that point, he assumed the title of King of Italy and became the first king of a united Italy since the 6th century, a title he held until his death in 1878. The Italians gave him the epithet of "Father of the Fatherland" (). The monument Altare della Patria (or "Vittoriano") in Rome was built in his honor.
---
Document ID: 2
Title: Victor Emmanuel II de Italia
Content: El resto del reinado de Victor Emmanuel II fue mucho más tranquilo. Después de establecer el reino de Italia, decidió continuar como el rey Victor Emmanuel II en lugar del vencedor Emmanuel I de Italia. Este fue un movimiento terrible en lo que respecta a las relaciones públicas, ya que no era indicativo del nuevo comienzo que el pueblo italiano quería y sugirió que Sardinia-Piedmont se había hecho cargo de la península italiana, en lugar de unificarla. A pesar de este contratiempo, el resto del reinado de Victor Emmanuel II se consumió al concluir los cabos sueltos y lidiar con problemas económicos y culturales. Su papel en el rector cotidiano disminuyó gradualmente, ya que se hizo cada vez más evidente que un rey ya no podía mantener a un gobierno en el cargo contra la voluntad del Parlamento. Como resultado, si bien la redacción de la Estatua Albertino estipulando que los ministros eran los únicos responsables de la Corona seguidos sin cambios, en la práctica ahora eran responsables ante el Parlamento.
---

prompt:
Information: Document ID: 1
Title: Rate of fire
Content: This is the mechanical rate of fire, or how fast the weapon "cycles" (loads, locks, fires, unlocks, ejects). Measurement of the cyclic rate assumes that the weapon is being operated as fast as possible and does not consider operator tasks (magazine changes, aiming, etc.). When the trigger is pulled, the rate at which rounds are fired is the cyclic rate. Typical cyclic rates of fire are 600–900 RPM for assault rifles, 1,000-1,100 RPM in some cases, 900-1,200 RPM for submachine guns and machine pistols, and 600-1,500 RPM for machine guns. M134 Miniguns mounted on attack helicopters and other combat vehicles can achieve rates of fire of over 100 rounds per second (6,000 RPM). Cyclic rate of fire is the only rate that can be determined precisely.
---

Title: Sorteo
Content: Fast Draw es uno de los deportes más rápidos del mundo. Cada vez se mide por debajo de un segundo, desde la señal para dibujar hasta cuando se detiene el temporizador. El récord actual de la Asociación Mundial de Draw de Draw (WFDA) para el sorteo rápido de clase abierta en un evento llamado globos en pie es .208 segundos, y eso incluye el tiempo que lleva reaccionar, dibujar, disparar y hacer estallar un objetivo global a ocho pies de distancia. Un competidor de clase mundial puede dibujar y disparar en menos de medio segundo. Dado que el tiempo de reacción humana promedio es de alrededor de 0.2 a 0.25 segundos, la ronda termina antes de que la mayoría de las personas puedan reaccionar. Los tiempos de reacción de los mejores tiradores de dibujo rápido son 0.145 segundos, lo que significa que la pistola está ladeada, dibujada, dirigida (desde la cadera) y se dispara en poco más de 0.06 segundos. Para establecer un récord mundial de asociación de sorteo, se debe disparar en la misma competencia que no es más de 0.30 segundos más lento que el primero; Esto está destinado a evitar una toma que anticipe que la señal de inicio establece un registro. En las competiciones donde se deben disparar dos rondas, en objetivos separados, menos de 0.10 segundos separan los disparos.
---

all_claims: Canadian inventor Reginald A.

Fessenden is credited as the first developer of reflection seismology, having conceived the idea of using reflected seismic waves to infer subsurface geology, applied for the initial seismic exploration patent in 1914 (issued 1917), and carried out early research on acoustic‐wave propagation following the Titanic disaster of 1912 and during World War I submarine‐detection work [1].
claims_retained: Fessenden is credited as the first developer of reflection seismology, having conceived the idea of using reflected seismic waves to infer subsurface geology, applied for the initial seismic exploration patent in 1914 (issued 1917), and carried out early research on acoustic‐wave propagation following the Titanic disaster of 1912 and during World War I submarine‐detection work [1].
prompt:
Information: Document ID: 1
Title: Reflection seismology
Content: The Canadian inventor Reginald Fessenden was the first to conceive of using reflected seismic waves to infer geology. His work was initially on the propagation of acoustic waves in water, motivated by the sinking of the Titanic by an iceberg in 1912. He also worked on methods of detecting submarines during World War I. He applied for the first patent on a seismic exploration method in 1914, which was issued in 1917. Due to the war, he was unable to follow up on the idea. John Clarence Karcher discovered seismic reflections independently while working for the United States Bureau of Standards (now the National Institute of Standards and Technology) on methods of sound ranging to detect artillery. In discussion with colleagues, the idea developed that these reflections could aid in exploration for petroleum. With several others, many affiliated with the University of Oklahoma, Karcher helped to form the Geological Engineering Company, incorporated in Oklahoma in April, 1920. The first field tests were conducted near Oklahoma City, Oklahoma in 1921.
---
Document ID: 2
Title: Sismología de reflexión
Content: La sismología de la reflexión (o la reflexión sísmica) es un método de exploración geofísica que utiliza los principios de la sismología para estimar las propiedades del subsuelo de la Tierra a partir de ondas sísmicas reflejadas. El método requiere una fuente sísmica controlada de energía, como la dinamita o la explosión de Tovex, una pistola de aire especializada o un vibrador sísmico, comúnmente conocido por el nombre de marca registrada Vibroseis. La sismología de reflexión es similar a la sonar y la ecolocalización. Este artículo trata sobre encuestas sísmicas de superficie; Para los perfiles sísmicos verticales, ver vsp.
Primero se observaron reflexiones y refracciones de ondas sísmicas en interfaces geológicas dentro de la Tierra en grabaciones de ondas sísmicas generadas por terremotos. El modelo básico del interior profundo de la Tierra se basa en observaciones de ondas sísmicas generadas por terremotos transmitidas a través del interior de la Tierra (por ejemplo, Mohorovičić, 1910). El uso de ondas sísmicas generadas por humanos para mapear en detalle la geología de los pocos kilómetros superiores de la corteza terrestre siguió poco después y se ha desarrollado principalmente debido a la empresa comercial, particularmente la industria del petróleo.
---

prompt:
Information: Document ID: 1
Title: Rugby football
Content: Rugby refers to the team sports rugby league and rugby union. Legend claims that Rugby football was started around the time of 1845 in Rugby School, Rugby, Warwickshire, England, although forms of football in which the ball was carried and tossed date to medieval times. Rugby eventually split into two sports in 1895 when twenty one clubs split from the original Rugby Football Union, to form the Northern Union (later to be named rugby league in 1922) in the George Hotel, Huddersfield, Northern England over the issue of payment to players, thus making rugby league the first code to turn professional and pay its players, rugby union turned fully professional in 1995. Both sports are run by their respective world governing bodies World Rugby (rugby union) and the Rugby League International Federation (rugby league). Rugby football was one of many versions of football played at English public schools in the 19th century. Although rugby league initially used rugby union rules, they are now wholly separate sports. In addition to these two codes, both American and Canadian football evolved from rugby football.
---
Document ID: 2
Title: Camino de rugby
Content: Una parte integral de Rugby Road es "Beta Bridge". En la década de 1850, se erigió un puente sobre las vías del tren de Chesapeake y Ohio en la ubicación de lo que ahora es Beta Bridge, pero la estructura actual se construyó en 1923. El puente era parte de un proyecto de pavimentación y mejora de toda la ciudad para preparar las calles del área de Charlottesville para el automóvil. Aunque originalmente se conocía simplemente como el puente de rugby Road, cuando la fraternidad Beta Theta Pi construyó su casa en la esquina de Canciller y Rugby en 1927, tomó su nombre actual. En 1971, esa ubicación de la fraternidad estaba cerrada, y la fraternidad Delta Upsilon se trasladó a su ubicación actual en 180 Rugby Road. Como los monitores no oficiales del puente, los hermanos y las promesas de DU pintarían sobre mensajes o mensajes ofensivos que no contenían 'Thx du' (por "gracias delta upsilon"). En 2011, Beta Theta Pi regresó a su casa original al lado del puente, y ahora los mensajes generalmente contienen 'thx beta'.

Title: Rockwood Hall
Content: Importer and merchant Edwin Bartlett obtained the property around 1848, demolished the farmhouse, and built Rockwood, an English Gothic castle of locally-quarried stone. Bartlett hired Gervase Wheeler to design the house, which was built in 1849.
Bartlett sold the house to his business partner William Henry Aspinwall in 1860; Aspinwall made it his summer home and improved the property and house, and purchased enough land to make his estate . Aspinwall would often travel from New York City to the property via his yacht "Firefly", which he could moor to his dock at Rockwood Hall.

prompt:
Information: Document ID: 1
Title: Banksia menziesii
Content: First described by the botanist Robert Brown in the early 19th century, no separate varieties of "Banksia menziesii" are recognised. It is found in Western Australia, from the Perth (32° S) region north to the Murchison River (27° S), and generally grows on sandy soils, in scrubland or low woodland. "Banksia menziesii" provides food for a wide array of invertebrate and vertebrate animals; birds and in particular honeyeaters are prominent visitors. A relatively hardy plant, "Banksia menziesii" is commonly seen in gardens, nature strips and parks in Australian urban areas with Mediterranean climates, but its sensitivity to dieback from the soil-borne water mould "Phytophthora cinnamomi" makes it short-lived in places with humid summers, such as Sydney. "Banksia menziesii" is widely used in the cut flower industry both in Australia and overseas.

prompt:
Information: Document ID: 1
Title: History of science fiction films
Content: Science fiction films appeared very early in the silent film era. The initial attempts were short films of typically 1 to 2 minutes in duration, shot in black and white, but sometimes with colour tinting. These usually had a technological theme, and were often intended to be humorous. "Le Voyage dans la Lune", created by Georges Méliès in 1902 is often considered to be the first science fiction film. It drew upon Jules Verne and H. G. Wells in its depiction of a spacecraft being launched to the moon in a large cannon. Its ground-breaking special effects pioneered the way for future science-fiction films, and it became largely popular after its release.

prompt:
Information: Document ID: 1
Title: John Part
Content: John Part (born June 29, 1966) is a Canadian professional darts player and commentator, nicknamed Darth Maple. Part is a three-times World Champion, having won the 1994 BDO World Darts Championship, and the PDC World Championship in 2003 and 2008. He is statistically North America's greatest darts player to date. He has the distinction of being the first non-UK player to win the World Championship, and the only non-European to date to win the PDC World Darts Championship. His first Championship was the second time a non-seeded player won the BDO World Darts Championship, and one of the few times where a player only lost one set in the entire tournament. His nine year gap between his first and second World Championships is tied with Ted Hankey for the longest gap between World Championships, and his third triumph in 2008 saw him become the first player in history to win a world title in three different venues, and the first to win at the Alexandra Palace. His 2008 win saw him join Phil Taylor, Eric Bristow, Raymond van Barneveld and John Lowe as the only players with three or more World Championships, and become only the second player (after Taylor) to win multiple PDC titles. His eleven televised PDC finals is tied with Dennis Priestley for the eighth most all time, and his £874,151 in prize money to date is the sixteenth highest amount in PDC history.

Title: Mantis
Content: The closest relatives of mantises are the termites and cockroaches (Blattodea), which are all within the superorder Dictyoptera. Mantises are sometimes confused with stick insects (Phasmatodea), other elongated insects such as grasshoppers (Orthoptera), or other unrelated insects with raptorial forelegs such as mantisflies (Mantispidae). Mantises are mostly ambush predators, but a few ground-dwelling species are found actively pursuing their prey. They normally live for about a year. In cooler climates, the adults lay eggs in autumn, then die. The eggs are protected by their hard capsules and hatch in the spring. Females sometimes practice sexual cannibalism, eating their mates after copulation.

prompt:

Title: Verdigris
Content: Verdigris is the common name for a green pigment obtained through the application of acetic acid to copper plates or the natural patina formed when copper, brass or bronze is weathered and exposed to air or seawater over a period of time. It is usually a basic copper carbonate, but near the sea will be a basic copper chloride. If acetic acid is present at the time of weathering, it may consist of copper(II) acetate.

Title: Estatua de la libertad
Content: Originalmente, la estatua era un color de cobre opaco, pero poco después de 1900 una pátina verde, también llamada Verdigris, causada por la oxidación de la piel de cobre, comenzó a extenderse. Ya en 1902 fue mencionado en la prensa; Para 1906 había cubierto por completo la estatua. Creyendo que la pátina era evidencia de corrosión, el Congreso autorizado para varias reparaciones y para pintar la estatua tanto por dentro como por fuera. Hubo una considerable protesta pública contra la pintura exterior propuesta. El Cuerpo de Ingenieros del Ejército estudió la Pátina para obtener cualquier efecto negativo en la estatua y concluyó que protegía la piel, "suavizó los contornos de la estatua y la hizo hermosa". La estatua estaba pintada solo en el interior. El Cuerpo de Ingenieros también instaló un ascensor para llevar a los visitantes desde la base hasta la parte superior del pedestal.

question_en: Can a septic tank explode?
report_en: Yes, a septic tank can explode because the decomposition of sewage produces sewer gas that contains methane and hydrogen sulfide, both highly flammable and potentially explosive; gas ignition can occur if the mixture contacts an open flame or sparks [1]. Methane levels have been measured up to about 300 ppmv in closed drains just 2 cm above the sewage, significantly higher than the 7–15 ppmv commonly found in open sewers, indicating that enclosed systems like septic tanks can accumulate concentrations high enough to reach their explosive limits if ventilation is inadequate [1].
