Title: Tanques del período de entreguerras
Content: Los franceses usaron una amplia gama de tanques, incluidos muchos tipos únicos. Francia fue el segundo productor de tanques más grande del mundo, detrás de la Unión Soviética (ver la producción de vehículos de combate blindados franceses durante la Segunda Guerra Mundial). Su clase de tanque de caballería ocupó el papel de lo que ahora se llama MBTS. También presentaron un diseño de tanque pesado y varios tipos más ligeros para explorar y soporte de infantería. Además de estos tipos, también estaban trabajando en tanques de avance súper pesados ​​(FCM F1). Los franceses no tenían un cuerpo de tanques independiente. Todos los tanques pertenecían a la infantería o la caballería. El Renault FT-17 tuvo una larga vida y vio uso en la Segunda Guerra Mundial e incluso más tarde en Indochina. Se utilizó tan lejos como en China, durante las guerras civiles chinas, y las versiones del tanque fueron utilizadas tanto contra y por los japoneses durante la invasión de China. Un gran número se abrió camino en las manos republicanas y nacionalistas durante la Guerra Civil española. Fueron utilizados en la revolución rusa tanto por los bolcheviques como por los rusos blancos, y más tarde por los finlandeses contra los soviéticos. Francia exportó el FT-17 hasta la Segunda Guerra Mundial. El diseño también fue desarrollado por los italianos como el Fiat 3000 y la URSS como la T-18.
---

Title: H-E-B
Content: The company was founded on November 26, 1905, when Florence Butt opened the C.C. Butt Grocery Store on the ground floor of her family home in Kerrville, Texas. In 1919, Howard Edward Butt, Florence's youngest son, took over the store upon his return from World War I. Shortly after becoming owner of his mother's small store, Howard tried four expansions into Central Texas, including one in Junction, all of which failed. Finally, in 1927, Howard launched a successful second store in Del Rio, Texas, followed by the purchase of three grocery stores in the Lower Rio Grande Valley. The first initials of Howard E. Butt became the name of the store.

Content: La historia de Food Emporium comienza en 1919, cuando Louis Daitch fundó Daitch Crystal Dairies, una compañía pública que cotiza en la Bolsa de Valores Americanas. Con los años, abrió tiendas en el área de la ciudad de Nueva York que venden mantequilla y huevos. Después de la Segunda Guerra Mundial, Daitch Crystal Dairies disfrutó de un tremendo crecimiento en el nuevo formato de supermercado, emergiendo en la década de 1950 como una cadena significativa. En 1955, Daitch y sus 34 tiendas (en la ciudad de Nueva York, los condados de Nassau y Suffolk, y en Connecticut, se fusionaron con la cadena de Shopwell Foods de 18 supermercados del condado de Westchester. Shopwell fue fundada por Sigmund Rosengarten, quien ingresó al negocio de los supermercados como una carnicería. Año, se abrieron siete nuevas tiendas y se agregaron nueve más adquiriendo la cadena de Diamond K.

Jacques-Jean era un banquero rico y conocido, que tenía un hijo (Jacques Félix Le Coulteux du Molay nació París el 29 de junio de 1779 y murió en Dijón el 1 de abril de 1812) con Genevieve antes de su divorcio. Durante su tiempo juntos, también compraron la famosa Malmaison cerca de París: algunos de esos estilos se reflejan en el castillo que ahora se encuentra. prompt:
Information: Document ID: 1
Title: Endocrinology
Content: The earliest study of endocrinology began in China. The Chinese were isolating sex and pituitary hormones from human urine and using them for medicinal purposes by 200 BCE. They used many complex methods, such as sublimation of steroid hormones. Another method specified by Chinese texts—the earliest dating to 1110—specified the use of saponin (from the beans of "Gleditsia sinensis") to extract hormones, but gypsum (containing calcium sulfate) was also known to have been used.
---
Document ID: 2
Title: Disruptor endocrino
Content: El término "disruptor endocrino" fue acuñado en el Centro de Conferencias Wingspread en Wisconsin, en 1991. Uno de los primeros documentos sobre el fenómeno fue por Theo Colborn en 1993. En este documento, declaró que los productos químicos ambientales interrumpen el desarrollo del sistema endocrino, y que los efectos de la exposición durante el desarrollo son a menudo permanentes.
Aunque la interrupción endocrina ha sido disputada por algunos, las sesiones de trabajo de 1992 a 1999 han generado declaraciones de consenso de científicos sobre el peligro de los disruptores endocrinos, particularmente en la vida silvestre y también en humanos.
---

prompt:
Information: Document ID: 1
Title: The Doctor (Doctor Who)
Content: The character of the Doctor was created by BBC Head of Drama, Sydney Newman. The first format document for the programme that was to become "Doctor Who" – then provisionally titled "The Troubleshooters" – was written in March 1963 by C. E. Webber, a staff writer who had been brought in to help develop the project. Webber's document contained a main character described as "The maturer man, 35–40, with some 'character twist.' " Newman was not keen on this idea and – along with several other changes to Webber's initial format – created an alternative lead character named Dr Who, a crotchety older man piloting a stolen time machine, on the run from his own far future world. No written record of Newman's conveyance of these ideas – believed to have taken place in April 1963 – exists, and the character of Dr Who first begins appearing in existing documentation from May of that year.
---

Davies), el personaje de Vince fue retratado como un ávido fanático de "Doctor Who", con referencias que aparecen muchas veces en forma de clips del programa. De manera similar, el personaje de Oliver en "acoplamiento" (creado y escrito por el actual corredor del programa Steven Moffat) es retratado como un coleccionista y entusiasta del "Doctor Who".
Las referencias a "Doctor Who" también han aparecido en las novelas de fantasía para adultos jóvenes "Brisingr" y "High Wizardry", el videojuego "Band de rock", el programa de comedia de natación para adultos "Robot Chicken", los episodios de "Family Guy" "Blue Harvest" y "420", y el juego "Runescape". question_en: What are the Troubles?
report_en: The Troubles were an ethno-nationalist conflict in Northern Ireland that began in the late 1960s, is often characterized as a “guerrilla” or “low-level” war, and is generally considered to have concluded with the 1998 Good Friday Agreement [1]. Title: CBS News Sunday Morning
Content: CBS News Sunday Morning is an American newsmagazine television program that has aired on CBS since January 28, 1979. Created by Robert Northshield and original host Charles Kuralt, the 90-minute program currently airs Sundays from 9:00 to 10:30 a.m. Eastern, Pacific Time from 7:00 to 8:30 a.m. and 8:00 to 9:30 a.m. in all other time zones (live in the Eastern and Central time zones, and on tape delay elsewhere). Since October 9, 2016, the show has been hosted by Jane Pauley, who also posts news segments, after the retirement of long-term host Charles Osgood. Osgood was the host for twenty-two years (and is the program's longest-serving host), taking over from Kuralt on April 10, 1994.

El 25 de septiembre de 2016 se anunció que Pauley asumiría como anfitrión de "CBS Sunday Morning" después del retiro de Charles Osgood. prompt:
Information: Document ID: 1
Title: XETV-TDT
Content: As the original American digital television transition date of 17 February 2009 approached, XETV had expressed intentions to follow other San Diego-area stations in ceasing transmission of its analog signal. While the U.S. switchover deadline of 17 February was later pushed back to 12 June 2009 and only applied to American-licensed stations in any case, plans were announced to voluntarily make the station's English-language programming digital-only. The analog signal would be repurposed to retransmit the Mexican Galavisión network (not to be confused with the American cable channel of the same name). Claims on XETV's website that the station was indeed going to transmit a digitally-exclusive signal were rescinded on 17 February 2009 as the station decided to delay cutting off its analog signal until after it secured approval from the Mexican government. XETV management later stated that it had decided to maintain its analog signal to benefit Mexican viewers. XETV's analog signal was eventually repurposed on 5 March 2012, when the station began multicasting on its digital signal with the addition of Televisa's youth-oriented Canal 5 network on subchannel 6.2 and on its analog feed, while digital channel 6.1 retained the newscasts, CW network and syndicated programs in English. On the same date, XHBJ-TV channel 45 dropped Canal 5 for Galavisión. Canal 5 replaced XETV's English-language programming on its analog signal, in order to serve Spanish-speaking viewers in Tijuana that did not have television sets with built-in digital tuners or digital converter boxes prior to the Tijuana market's 2013 transition to digital television. The affiliation switch coincided with the commencement of digital multicasting on Televisa's Tijuana stations. Canal 5 moved to its primary channel on 31 May 2017, at which point, the 6.2 subchannel was decommissioned.
---
Document ID: 2
Title: Xetv-tdt

KFMB-TV "The CW San Diego" ha reemplazado a XETV en los sistemas de cable estadounidenses, así como a los proveedores de televisión satellitas Directv y Dish Network. XETV es transportado por todos los sistemas de cable mexicanos en su área de cobertura, ya que el transporte de estaciones de transmisión locales es ordenado por el Instituto Federal de Telecomunicaciones (IFT).

The city was largely in ruins when visited by Xuanzang, and suffered further damage at the hands of Muslim raiders in the 12th century. El imperio se dividió en provincias y las provincias se dividieron aún más en distritos. Las aldeas eran las unidades más pequeñas. El reino cubrió a Gujarat, el noreste de la India, el sudeste de Pakistán, Odisha, el norte de Madhya Pradesh y el este de la India con capital en Pataliputra, moderna Patna. question_en: How much dopamine is in the human brain?
report_en: Because dopamine is constantly synthesized, released, taken back up and enzymatically degraded, its absolute quantity is not fixed, but biochemical measurements in post-mortem tissue indicate that the entire human brain typically contains only a few milligrams of free dopamine at any moment (well below 0.01 g). This modest pool is maintained by roughly 400,000 dopaminergic neurons whose cell bodies are clustered in six small mid-brain and hypothalamic regions (substantia nigra, ventral tegmental area, posterior hypothalamus, arcuate nucleus, zona incerta and periventricular nucleus, corresponding to groups A8–A14) but whose axons project widely and exert strong modulatory effects across the brain [1].

prompt:
Information: Document ID: 1
Title: Dopamine
Content: Dopaminergic neurons (dopamine-producing nerve cells) are comparatively few in number—a total of around 400,000 in the human brain—and their cell bodies are confined in groups to a few relatively small brain areas. However their axons project to many other brain areas, and they exert powerful effects on their targets. These dopaminergic cell groups were first mapped in 1964 by Annica Dahlström and Kjell Fuxe, who assigned them labels starting with the letter "A" (for "aminergic"). In their scheme, areas A1 through A7 contain the neurotransmitter norepinephrine, whereas A8 through A14 contain dopamine. The dopaminergic areas they identified are the substantia nigra (groups 8 and 9); the ventral tegmental area (group 10); the posterior hypothalamus (group 11); the arcuate nucleus (group 12); the zona incerta (group 13) and the periventricular nucleus (group 14).

Los fármacos neurolépticos (antipsicóticos), que a veces se usan para tratar la esquizofrenia, se dirigen al sistema de dopamina.

prompt:
Information: Document ID: 1
Title: Imperial Japanese Navy in World War II
Content: Even after the disaster at Philippine Sea, the IJN was still a formidable force. Of the 12 battleships that were available at the beginning of the war in 1941-42, nine still remained operational, together with 14 out of the original 18 heavy cruisers. However, efforts to rebuild the carrier force were unsuccessful since the training given to new aviators was of a very low standard. Consequently, the new carriers never went to sea with a full air group. This left the Japanese with a ragtag collection of carriers, led by the "Zuikaku", which was the sole survivor of the Pearl Harbor attack force. The Japanese were left with two choices, either to commit their remaining strength in an all-out offensive, or to sit by while the Americans occupied the Philippines and cut the sea lanes between Japan and vital resources from the Dutch East Indies and Malaya. The plan devised by the Japanese was a final attempt to create a decisive battle by utilizing their last remaining strength, the firepower of its heavy cruisers and battleships, which were to be all committed against the American beachhead at Leyte. The Japanese planned to use their remaining carriers as bait, in order to lure the American carriers away from Leyte Gulf long enough for the heavy warships to enter and destroy any American ships present.

claim: Supportive care targets the organs most affected: dialysis may be required for acute kidney injury or severe hyperphosphatemia, while calcium carbonate is given orally once serum calcium is checked to control phosphate levels
question_en: Can leptospirosis be cured?
report_en: Yes—because leptospirosis is a bacterial infection, it can usually be cured when diagnosis is prompt and appropriate therapy is started; standard practice is to give effective antibiotics (e.g., doxycycline or penicillin) early and provide supportive measures until the infection and its complications resolve. Supportive care targets the organs most affected: dialysis may be required for acute kidney injury or severe hyperphosphatemia, while calcium carbonate is given orally once serum calcium is checked to control phosphate levels [1]. In patients with pronounced bleeding tendencies, some specialists recommend a short course (7–10 days) of tapering corticosteroids such as prednisolone to curb hemorrhagic inflammation [1]. Outcomes are generally favorable when treatment begins in the first week of illness, with reported case-fatality rates falling below 5 % in high-resource settings; delays, however, allow the bacteria to damage the liver, kidneys, lungs, or heart and can push mortality above 10 %. Therefore, early medical attention and adherence to antibiotic and organ-specific management plans give most patients an excellent chance of full recovery.
all_claims: Yes—because leptospirosis is a bacterial infection, it can usually be cured when diagnosis is prompt and appropriate therapy is started; standard practice is to give effective antibiotics (e.g., doxycycline or penicillin) early and provide supportive measures until the infection and its complications resolve.

Title: Leptospirosis
Content: Treatment for hyperphosphatemia consists of treating the underlying disease, dialysis where appropriate, or oral administration of calcium carbonate, but not without first checking the serum calcium levels (these two levels are related). Organ-specific care and treatment are essential in cases of kidney, liver, or heart involvement.

Title: Leptospira noguchii
Content: "Leptospira noguchii" es otra bacteria patogénica que causa leptospirosis. La leptospirosis se puede transferir de una multitud de maneras. La leptospirosis puede transferirse de animales a humanos (zoonosis), humanos a humanos, o animales a animales a través de la ingesta de fluidos corporales contaminados, como la orina y la sangre. La enfermedad normalmente se absorbe a través de las membranas mucosas de otro animal o humano y se excreta del cuerpo en la orina. El individuo infectado puede ser asintomático o tener síntomas muy graves. En casos graves, se han producido insuficiencia renal o hepática, meningitis aséptica y hemorragias pulmonares fatales en humanos.

Definen la edad mínima de empleo a los quince años, excepto en países con economías e instalaciones educativas mal desarrolladas. En tales países, la edad mínima de empleo es de catorce años. En la nueva versión, Gollum fingió que le mostraría a Bilbo la salida si perdiera el juego de acertijo, pero en realidad planeó usar el anillo para matar y comer el hobbit. Al descubrir el anillo que faltaba, de repente se dio cuenta de la respuesta al último acertijo de Bilbo: "¿Qué tengo en mi bolsillo?" - y voló a una ira. Bilbo descubrió inadvertidamente el poder de invisibilidad del anillo mientras huyó, lo que le permitió seguir a Gollum sin ser detectado hasta una entrada trasera de las cuevas. Gollum estaba convencido de que Bilbo sabía la salida todo el tiempo, y esperaba interceptarlo cerca de la entrada, para que los duendes detengan a Bilbo y encuentren el anillo. Bilbo al principio pensó en matar a Gollum para escapar, pero fue abrumado por la lástima, por lo que simplemente saltó sobre él. Cuando Bilbo escapó, Gollum gritó: "¡Ladrón, ladrón, ladrón! ¡Baggins! ¡Lo odiamos, lo odiamos, lo odiamos para siempre!"

Title: Canada's Worst Driver
Content: Canada's Worst Driver is a Canadian television series on Discovery Channel, based on "Britain's Worst Driver" and is part of the Worst Driver television franchise. The series is produced by Proper Television, whose president, Guy O'Sullivan, was the director of the original "Britain's Worst Driver" series until its cancellation in 2003. O'Sullivan served as executive producer of "Canada's Worst Driver" until his death in April 2017, doubling as executive producer of sister series "Canada's Worst Handyman" until its cancellation in 2011. As such, "Canada's Worst Driver" is considered to be the production company's flagship show and, with 14 seasons aired as of December 2018, the longest-running of any "Worst" series to date. Unlike other "Worst" series around the world, where being a graduate is rewarded with a new car while the Worst Driver has their car destroyed, "Canada's Worst Driver" emphasizes the learning process of the contestants and the science of driving and is often more serious than any other "Worst Driver" version around the world, awarding no prizes aside from a trophy at the end of each season for being named the worst (with the exception of season twelve, in which, despite ultimately being named the worst, Krystal McCann wasn't even worthy of being awarded the trophy, leading to Tyler Dupont becoming the first-ever nominee to be awarded the "Final Graduate" trophy), as the point of the show is to educate rather than entertain, as other versions are mainly comedic. The series is also aired dubbed in French in Canada as "Les Pires Chauffards Canadiens" on the Z channel. Until 2011, when "Canada's Worst Handyman" was cancelled and later replaced in 2015 with "Blood, Sweat & Tools," "Canada's Worst Driver" and "Canada's Worst Handyman" were the two highest-rated programs on Discovery Channel Canada.

The stadium opened in 2001, after the controlled implosion of the teams' previous stadium, Three Rivers Stadium. The stadium is named for the locally based H. J. prompt:
Information: Document ID: 1
Title: History of psychology
Content: Psychology was a branch of the domain of philosophy until the 1870s, when it developed as an independent scientific discipline in Germany and the United States. Psychology as a self-conscious field of experimental study began in 1879, in Leipzig Germany, when Wilhelm Wundt founded the first laboratory dedicated exclusively to psychological research in Germany. Wundt was also the first person to refer to himself as "a psychologist". Other important early contributors to the field include Hermann Ebbinghaus (a pioneer in the study of memory), William James (the American father of pragmatism), and Ivan Pavlov (who developed the procedures associated with classical conditioning).
---
Document ID: 2
Title: Psicología clínica
Content: El campo comenzó a organizarse bajo el nombre de "psicología clínica" en 1917 con la fundación de la Asociación Americana de Psicología Clínica. Esto solo duró hasta 1919, después de lo cual la Asociación Americana de Psicología (fundada por G. Stanley Hall en 1892) desarrolló una sección sobre psicología clínica, que ofreció certificación hasta 1927. El crecimiento en el campo fue lento durante los próximos años, cuando varias organizaciones psicológicas no conectadas se unieron como la Asociación Americana de Psicología Aplicada en 1930, que actuaría como el foro primario para los psicólogos hasta después de la Guerra Mundial cuando el APA Reorganizó. En 1945, la APA creó lo que ahora se llama División 12, su División de Psicología Clínica, que sigue siendo una organización líder en el campo. Las sociedades y asociaciones psicológicas en otros países de habla inglesa desarrollaron divisiones similares, incluso en Gran Bretaña, Canadá, Australia y Nueva Zelanda.
---

Soy el pionero que debe romper el camino; pero el Maestro Philip viene suavemente y gentilmente, las recogidas y las aguas al corazón, ya que Dios ha finalmente con respecto con los regalos con los regalos; Luther también hizo justicia a las enseñanzas de Melanchthon, elogiando un año antes de su muerte en el prefacio a sus propios escritos, los "loci" revisados ​​sobre ellas y llamando a Melanchthon "un instrumento divino que ha logrado lo mejor en el departamento de teología a la gran ira del diablo y su tribu Scabby". Es notable que Luther, que atacó con vehemencia a hombres como Erasmus y Bucer, cuando pensó que la verdad estaba en juego, nunca habló directamente contra Melanchthon, e incluso durante su melancolía los últimos años conquistó su temperamento.

prompt:
Information: Document ID: 1
Title: Red-eared firetail
Content: The red-eared firetail is a seed eating estrildid, discreet and unusually solitary for an Australian grass finch species. This species often remains unobserved in dense vegetation while foraging in the lower storey. Their presence is revealed by distinctive calls and the bird is most frequently seen when perched high on the limb of a tree such as marri. The individuals form mated pairs rather than grouping. Their individual range is an area around one to two hundred metres across and they may join others while feeding where their territories overlap. Earnest defence of sites only occurs close to the nest, so boundaries between pairs may intersect without incident. Fledglings are eventually fought and driven from the nest site.

Title: Firetail con orejas rojas
Content: El Firetail de orejas rojas ("Stagonopleura Oculata"), también conocida como Boorin, es una pequeña especie de pájaro con forma de pinzón. Ocurre en las densas vegetación de humedales de regiones costeras a subconterreses en el suroeste de Australia. Su apariencia se considera atractiva, con manchas blancas, salros negros y vívidas marcas carmesí en la oreja y la cola superior. Las coletas de fuego de orejas rojas generalmente solo se vislumbran brevemente, si es que lo hacen, ya que se mueven rápida y discretamente a través de su hábitat. La mayoría de las observaciones ocurren cuando se escucha su voz suave, o en vuelo cuando se enjuagan del denso exfoliante. Los machos y las hembras son similares en coloración y vínculo como pares de por vida que ocupan un territorio centrado en su sitio de inicio y nido. La especie ocupa un nicho ecológico similar al hermoso cola de fuego "stagonopleura bella" que se encuentra en el este de Australia, aunque a diferencia de otras especies del género, solo ocasionalmente se agrupan y casi nunca se ven en grandes rebaños.

The Core Plan, which would take about six years to complete and cost $1 billion based on an August 1973 cost estimate, was submitted to the Federal government on August 21, 1974. Hubo un segundo presunto ataque el 4 de agosto, que luego se demostró que era una falsedad. Estos ataques, y las acciones navales siguientes, conocidas como el incidente del Golfo de Tonkin, fueron aprovechados por el presidente Lyndon Johnson para asegurar el paso del Congreso de los Estados Unidos de la Resolución del Sudeste Asiático (mejor conocido como la Resolución del Golfo de Tonkin) el 7 de agosto de 1964, lo que lleva a una escala dramática de la Guerra de Vietnam. Desde entonces se ha alegado que el incidente del Golfo de Tonkin fue en parte una fabricación, incluido el testimonio de los participantes, como el comandante del escuadrón James Stockdale, en los eventos mismos. Incluso los ataques que sucedieron no fueron no provocados, sino el resultado de las redadas de Oplan 34A, que en esencia era una operación estadounidense.

Title: Battle of Austerlitz
Content: The Battle of Austerlitz (2 December 1805/11 Frimaire An XIV FRC), also known as the Battle of the Three Emperors, was one of the most important and decisive engagements of the Napoleonic Wars. In what is widely regarded as the greatest victory achieved by Napoleon, the "Grande Armée" of France defeated a larger Russian and Austrian army led by Emperor Alexander I and Holy Roman Emperor Francis II. The battle occurred near the town of Austerlitz in the Austrian Empire (modern-day Slavkov u Brna in the Czech Republic). Austerlitz brought the War of the Third Coalition to a rapid end, with the Treaty of Pressburg signed by the Austrians later in the month. The battle is often cited as a tactical masterpiece, in the same league as other historic engagements like Cannae or Gaugamela.

Esto fue a mediano y largo plazo de gran importancia para la casa real de Francia que para De Montfort, y con la batalla de Bouvines debía asegurar la posición de Philip Augustus Vis A Vis Inglaterra y el Imperio. Title: U.S. Route 17
Content: U.S. Route 17 or U.S. Highway 17 (abbreviation U.S. 17, US 17, also known as the Coastal Highway) is a north–south United States highway. The highway spans the southeastern United States and is close to the Atlantic Coast for much of its length. The highway's southern terminus is at Punta Gorda, Florida, at an intersection with US 41. Traveling north, US 17 joins up with US 50 in Paris, Virginia, and the northern terminus of US 17 is in downtown Winchester, Virginia. This is also the point at which the portion of US 50 called the Northwestern Turnpike begins.
